description: Proth numbers: least k such that 2*n*k + 1 is a prime.
comments: Records are 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 10, 12, 15, 17,...(A239746) at n = 1, 4, 12, 19, 59, 92, 159, 227, 256, 514,...(A239727)  - _Zak Seidov_, Mar 25 2014Is the sequence bounded? - _Zak Seidov_, Mar 25 2014Answer: No, for any given N a number n such that a(n) > N can be constructed by the Chinese Remainder Theorem, see A239727. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 25 2014
links: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Do[k = 1; cp = n*k + 1; While[ ! PrimeQ[cp], k++; cp = n*k + 1]; Print[k], {n, 2, 400, 2}] (* _Lei Zhou_, Feb 23 2005 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n)=my(k); while(!isprime(2*n*(k++)+1),);k \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 25 2014
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_
